ygData.subject: RE: Charisma effect on magic resists
ygData.msgSnippet: ... With 95 charisma (base) I miss on around 20% of my songs. Mind you, not level 22 or 23 songs, I m talking about Jig, Selo s, and Hymm.  It s truly
ygData.messageBody:
>At 120 charisma I consider the number of missed notes I get to
>be intolerable. I'd estimate I'm missing notes about 10%-20%
>of the time on low-level songs (will have to test it some time
>this week). If it's worse with lower charisma, I don't know
>how any of you are able to stand it.

With 95 charisma (base) I miss on around 20% of my songs.
Mind you, not level 22 or 23 songs, I'm talking about Jig,
Selo's, and Hymm. It's truly embarrassing. It's like a
level 25 cleric fizzling minor heal. I like to group with
players who are around 4 to 8 levels higher than I am, and
it makes bards look pretty bad. Needless to say, I feedback'd
the amount of missed notes I was getting recently, because
it wasn't like this before. And I will always wonder everytime
a 'spdat.eff' file comes my way, if I have been nerfed again.

>this entire weekend because I actually get to play the game,
>instead of assidiously watching the chat window for "missed
>a note" messages. I played my bard again a couple hours
>tonight, and half the time I didn't even know what was going
>on or what song effects I had up because I was so busy trying
>to watch for and recover from missed notes. It is very
>frustrating.

You and me both brother. I'm too busy pushing hotkeys to
start songs, getting bashed, and figuring out which songs
played, which ended, which never even started... It's
something I'd rather not worry about with songs I learned
20 levels ago.

Harmonic Distortion, 25th drummer.
League of Antonican Bards, The Wind Spirit's Song
< Keepers of Norrath > Innoruuk
